channel.title: iPad
channel.description:
Is that seriously what apple called it?
Live twitter feed here: [url]https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/01/26/apple-tablet-twitter-upda_n_437265.html[/url]
And liveblog here: [url]https://www.macworld.com/article/145805/2010/01/apple_event.html?lsrc=twt_danfrakes[/url]
Looks like it's a 9.7 inch screen, 16-64 HDD, one a half pounds, half an inch thick. Works like the ipod touch and iphone in the sense that you have to get apps for it. It's very similar to a big ipod touch with a bunch of extra features. No camera. Uses wireless n. You can run iphone apps on it though. 10 hours of battery life, has an accelerometer and a compass. Costs between $600-$800.
[img]https://images.macworld.com/liveupdate/2010/01/event/images/sjobswipad.jpg[/img]
Thanks, but no thanks for this one Steve.

item.title: iPad
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
The iPad isn’t a replacement for a real computer, and anyone who thinks it should be has no idea how things work. It’s meant to be more portable than a netbook and it’s meant to be able to browse the web and do basic web stuff comfortably, since most people use their netbook for that anyway, however, netbooks are too slow to run a proper operating system, which makes them quite lame computers, unless you get a netbook with a good processor, in which case you might as well just get a normal laptop! It’s not for everyone.

It’s a big iPod Touch basically, but with the iPod Touch, browsing the web for more than a couple of minutes is annoying, since it’s a small device.

Such a device would be unable to run proper applications such as Photoshop and traditional apps you run all the time, not only because the processor isn’t suited for that, but also because it uses a touchscreen, which requires a completely different way of interaction, which is incompatible with most applications. Therefore, it has its own, special applications that are suited specifically for the iPad and its touchscreen. If it had OS X or Windows on it, you wouldn’t even be able to scroll since the scroll bar would be too small for your fingers to touch it properly. This is why it has to have different software.

I totally see what kind of people the iPad is made for, and I think it makes a lot of sense, which is why they have sold more than a million so quickly.

Anyone who thinks that it should run a full OS or that it should have Half-Life 2 or Photoshop knows nothing about technology.

If you think it’s too expensive, try using any other tablet device on the market for a couple of days and you’ll start understanding.

Oh, and no one said YOU have to buy it, it’s aimed at a large group of people who will happily buy it and use it, while other will stick with other solutions. Which is also the case with every product in the world.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
I might actually grab a 16GB WiFi + 3G. The plans in Australia aren’t that bad, especially the $80 for 8GB that lasts for 6 months. Works out to be $13.33 a month, or $6.66 a pay. If the net ever goes down at home or if I take it somewhere on holidays or w/e it’d be damn handy!

Read full topic

item.title: iPad
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
I’m heading to the US on the 22nd of May for 5 weeks, landing in San Fran. Pretty tempted to head to the Apple Store and pick up a 16GB WiFi, maybe 32GB depending on how much I save for the trip.

Been umming and arring the past few weeks but pretty set on getting one now. I’ve always loved PCs but never liked laptops. I’ve had an iPhone 3G for almost 2 years now and love it, so I’m pretty confident the iPad will be perfect for me. I already have a beast of a computer that I can tweak and play around with to my hearts content, so I don’t really care if the iPad is locked down.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
sersoft:

I’ve had a macbook pro for a week and all I wanted to do was smash it to bits, damn boring apple design.

But hasn’t the unibody already caused your eyeballs to explode in unrelenting glorious euphoria?

cough

I like the aluminum body precisely for its simplicity; all the plastic chassis I’ve had over the years have fallen apart, the latest being an Asus which had the hinge rip out of the case, taking half the screen with it. Plus, it looks nice .

Read full topic
